info.title: Dominion Card API
info.description:
Full-featured Dominion Kingdom Cards API.

This API is intended to power companion apps for the board game Dominion and allows you to quickly and easily obtain card sets and card details for the Kingdom Cards used to play the  game.

## Data Information ##

* In the cost, `Ãž` means "potion".
* In the description, `\\n` denotes where a new line should be inserted.
* In the description, `\\d` denotes where a horizontal break should be inserted.

## Public GitHub Repository ##

See https://github.com/wesbuck/DominionCardAPI for more information.

post.description: Send credentials to obtain an authentication token. A token is required to use this API.

get.description: Get a set of 10 unique random Dominion Kingdom Cards. This function is intended to power "deck builder" or "card picker" applications.

example.card_text: Set aside this and another card from your hand. Return them to your deck at the end of the game.\dWorth 2VP
Gain a copy of a card costing up to $6 that the player to your right gained on his last turn.
+3 Cards\n +1 Action\nDiscard 3 cards.
+1 Buy\nDiscard any number of cards. +1 Card per card discarded. Discard any number of cards. +$1 per card discarded the second time.
+1 Card. +2 Actions. You may discard a Treasure card. If you do, take a Coin token.
+1 Card\n+1 Action\dWhen you discard this from play, you may exchange it for a Treasure Hunter.
+1 Buy\n+$1\dWhen you discard this from play, you may exchange it for a Soldier.
Play this as if it were an Action card in the Supply costing up to 5 Coins. This is that card until it leaves play.
+1 Victory\nTrash from 1 to 3 differently named cards from your hand. Add 1 Victory to the Temple Supply pile.\dWhen you gain this, take all the Victory from the Temple Supply pile.

get.description: Get a single random Dominion Kingdom Card.

example.card_text: When you buy an Action card, if you have a copy of it in play, take 2 Victory from here.\dSetup: Put 6 Victory here per player.

get.description: Get the list of **all** Dominion Kingdom Card(s). Alias of `/cards/`.

example.card_text: +$2\nReveal the top 3 cards of the Black Market deck. You may buy one of them immediately. Put the unbought cards on the bottom of the Black Market deck in any order.\d(Before the game, make a Black Market deck out of one copy of each Kingdom card not in
Reveal the top 5 cards of your deck. The player to your left chooses one for you to discard. Draw the rest.

+1 Action\nChoose one; you get the version in parentheses: Each player gets +1 (+3) Cards; or each player gains a Silver (Gold); or each player may trash a card from his hand and gain a card costing exactly $1 ($2) more.

You may set this aside. If you do, set aside an Action card from your hand costing up to $4. At the start of each of your turns, play that Action, setting it aside again when you discard it from play. (Stop playing it if you fail to set it aside on a turn you play it.)
Worth $2\dWhen you shuffle, you may put this anywhere in your deck.
Allows the buyer to gain a cheap Action card and play it immediately at the start of their next turn.
+1 Card\n+2 Actions\dAt the start of Clean-up, if you have this and no more than one other Action card in play, you may put this on top of your deck.
Reveal cards from your deck until you reveal 2 Treasure cards. Put those Treasure cards in your hand and discard the other revealed cards.
Gain a silver card; put it on top of your deck. Each other player reveals a Victory card from his hand and puts it on his deck (or reveals a hand with no Victory cards).
+1 Action\nDiscard any number of cards.\n+1 Card per card discarded.
+$2\nYou may immediately put your deck into your discard pile.
Trash up to 4 cards from your hand.
+4 Cards\n+1 Buy\nEach other player draws a card.
Trash this card. Gain a card costing up to $5.
+2 Actions\n+1 Buy\n+$2.
Worth 1VP for every 10 cards in your deck (rounded down).
+2 Cards\n+1 Action.
Draw until you have 7 cards in hand. You may set aside any Action cards drawn this way, as you draw them; discard the set aside cards after you finish drawing.

+1 Card
+1 Action

+$1.
+$2\nEach other player discards down to 3 cards in his hand.

+2 Cards\dWhen another player plays an Attack card, you may reveal this from your hand. If you do, you are unaffected by that Attack.
Trash a Copper from your hand. If you do, +$3.
Trash a card from your hand. Gain a card costing up to $2 more than the trashed card.
+3 Cards
+1 Card\n+1 Action\nEach player (including you) reveals the top card of his deck and either discards it or puts it back, your choice.

Each other player reveals the top 2 cards of his deck. If they revealed any Treasure cards, they trash one of them that you choose. You may gain any or all of these trashed cards. They discard the other revealed cards.
Choose an Action card in your hand. Play it twice.

+$2\nIf you've played 3 or more Actions this turn (counting this): +1 Card; +1 Action.
Copper produces an extra $1 this turn.

Choose one: +3 Cards; or +2 Actions.\dWorth 2VP
Choose two: +1 Card; +1 Action; +1 Buy; +$1.\n(The choices must be different.)

Each other player reveals cards from the top of his deck until revealing one costing $3 or more. He trashes that card and may gain a card costing at most $2 less than it. He discards the other revealed cards.
+1 Action\nReveal the top 4 cards of your deck. Put the revealed Victory cards into your hand. Put the other cards on top of your deck in any order.

Discard any number of cards. +$1 per card discarded.\dWhen another player plays an Attack card, you may reveal this from your hand. If you do, +2 cards, then put 2 cards from your hand on top of your deck.
+2 Actions\nReveal your hand.\nIf you have no Action cards in hand, +2 Cards.

+$2\nEach other player trashes the top card of his deck and gains a card with the same cost that you choose.
+3 Cards\nEach other player chooses one: he discards 2 cards; or he gains a Curse card, putting it in his hand.
Trash 2 cards from your hand. If you do, gain a silver card; put it into your hand.

+1 Card\n+1 Action\nName a card, then reveal the top card of your deck. If it is the named card, put it in your hand.
Reveal a card from your hand. Return up to 2 copies of it from your hand to the Supply.\nThen each other player gains a copy of it.

You may reveal a Province card from your hand. If you do, gain a Gold card, putting it into your hand. Otherwise, gain a Silver card, putting it into your hand.
+2 Actions\n+$1\nAt the start of your next turn: +1 Action; +$1.

+1 Action\nLook at the top 3 cards of your deck. Trash one of them. Discard one of them. Put the other one on top of your deck.
Now and at the start of your next turn: +$2.

+2 Actions\nChoose one: Set aside the top card of your deck face down on your Native Village mat; or put all the cards from your mat into your hand.\nYou may look at the cards on your mat at any time; return them to your deck at the end of the game.
+$2\nLook at the top 5 cards of your deck. Either discard all of them, or put them back on top of your deck in any order.
You only draw 3 cards (instead of 5) in this turn's Clean-up phase. Take an extra turn after this one. This can't cause you to take more than two consecutive turns.
+1 Card\n+1 Action\nLook at the bottom card of your deck. You may put it on top.

Choose one: Each other player reveals the top 2 cards of his deck, trashes a revealed Treasure that you choose, discards the rest, and if anyone trashed a Treasure you take a Coin token; or, +$1 per Coin token you've taken with Pirate Ships this game.
+1 Buy\nTrash a card from your hand. +$ equal to its cost.
Each other player discards the top card of his deck, then gains a Curse card, putting it on top of his deck.
Gain a copy of a card costing up to $6 that the player to your right gained on his last turn.

+1 Buy\n+$1\dWhen you discard this from play, you may put one of your Treasures from play on top of your deck.
When you play this, count your deck and discard pile. Worth $1 per 5 cards total between them (rounded down).

The player to your left takes an extra turn after this one, in which you can see all cards he can and make all decisions for him. Any cards he would gain on that turn, you gain instead; any cards of his that are trashed are set aside and returned to his discard pile at end of turn.

Take 2 Coin tokens. You may trash a card from your hand and then pay any number of Coin tokens. If you did trash a card, gain a card with a cost of up to the cost of the trashed card plus the number of Coin tokens you paid.
+1 Action\n+1 Buy\nTake a Coin token.

Name a card. Reveal the top 3 cards of your deck. Trash the matches. Put the rest back on top in any order.\dWhen you buy this, you may overpay for it. For each $1 you overpaid, look at the top card of your deck; trash it, discard it, or put it back.

+1 Card\n+1 Action\nReveal the top card of your deck. If it is an Action, play it.\dWhen you buy this, you may overpay for it. For each $1 you overpaid, look through your discard pile and put a card from it on top of your deck.
Name a card. Reveal cards from the top of your deck until you reveal 3 cards that are not the named card. Put those cards into your hand and discard the rest.
Worth $1\dWhen you buy this, you may overpay for it. If you do, gain a Silver per $1 you overpaid.
+1 Buy\n+$1.\dWhile this is in play, when you buy a card, take a Coin token.
+1 Card. +2 Actions. You may discard a Treasure card. If you do, take a Coin token.
Gain a Gold. Each other player gains a Curse. Each player who did draws a card.
Trash a card from your hand. Gain 2 cards each costing less than it.\dWhen you buy this, you may overpay for it. If you do, gain 2 Action cards each costing the amount you overpaid.

You may trash a Treasure from your hand. Each other player with 5 or more cards in hand discards a copy of it (or reveals a hand without it). Gain a Treasure card costing up to $3 more than the trashed card, putting it on top of your deck.
Once per turn: If you have no Treasures in play, gain a card costing up to $4.
Now and at the start of your next turn, choose one: +$1; or trash a card from your hand; or gain a Silver.

+1 Action
+1 Card
+$1
Discard any number of cards. You may gain a card costing exactly $1 per card discarded, putting it on top of your deck.
Take your -$1 token. Gain 2 cards each costing up to $4.
Trash up to 2 cards you have in play.
+1 Buy\nOnce per turn: If your -1 Card token isn't on your deck, put it there and +$1.
Each other player takes his -$1 token. Now and at the start of your next turn:\n+1 Buy\dWhile this is in play, cards cost $1 less on your turns, but not less than $0.
+1 Card\n+1 Action\nAt the start of your next turn, +$1.\dWhen another player plays an Attack card, you may play this from your hand. (+1 Action has no effect if it's not your turn.)
+1 Action\nFor the rest of the game, when another player plays an Attack, it doesn't affect you, and when you play an Action, +1 Action.\n(This stays in play. This is not in the Supply.)
Worth $1\nWhen you play this, put it on your Tavern mat.\dDirectly after resolving an Action, you may call this, for +2 Actions.
You may play an Action card from your hand twice. Gain a copy of it.\dWhen you discard this from play, you may exchange it for a Teacher.\n(This is not in the Supply.)
Put this on your Tavern mat.\dWorth 4VP if on your Tavern mat at the end of the game (otherwise worth 0VP).
+1 Action\nNow and at the start of your next turn: +2 Cards, then discard 2 cards.
Put this on your Tavern mat.\dWhen you gain a card costing up to $6, you may call this, to gain a copy of that card.
Draw 2 extra cards for your next hand.
Move your -$2 cost token to an Action Supply pile (cards from that pile cost $2 less on your turns, but not less than $0).

+2 Cards
+1 Action
Discard a card.\dWhen you discard this from play, you may exchange it for a Disciple.
(This is not in the Supply.)
+2 Cards\nSet aside up to 2 cards from your hand face down. At the start of your next turn, put them into your hand.

Turn your Journey token over (it starts face up). If it's face down, +$1. If it's face up, +$5, and each other player reveals the top card of his deck, trashes it if it costs from $3 to $6, and otherwise discards it and gains a Curse.
+1 Card\n+1 Action\nPut this on your Tavern mat.\dAt the start of your turn, you may call this, to discard your hand and draw 5 cards.
Until you next turn, when any other player buys a card, he puts his hand on top of his deck in any order.\nAt the start of your next turn:\n+3 Cards
+$2\nGain a Treasure.\dWhen you discard this from play, you may exchange it for a Champion.\n(This is not in the Supply.)
At the start of each of your turns for the rest of the game:\d+1 Card\d(This stays in play.)
Once per game: Set aside a non-Victory Action card from the Supply costing up to $4. Move your Estate token to it (your Estates gain the abilities and types of that card).
Move your +1 Action token to an Action Supply pile (when you play a card from that pile, you first get +1 Action).
+2 Cards\n+2 Actions\dWhen you gain this, each other player draws a card.
+1 Card\n+1 Action\nReveal the top card of your deck. If it's a Treasure, put it into your hand. If it's an Action or Victory card, gain a Magpie.
+1 Buy\n+$2\nYou may put your deck into your discard pile.\dWhen this is your first buy in a turn, gain a card costing up to $4, and each other player gains a copy of it.
Choose one: Put a Copper from your hand onto your Tavern mat; or +$1 per Copper on your Tavern mat.
Once per turn: If the previous turn wasn't yours, take another turn after this one, in which you can't buy cards.
+1 Card\n+1 Action\dWhen you discard this from play, you may exchange it for a Treasure Hunter.
Move your +1 Card token to an Action Supply pile (when you play a card from that pile, you first get +1 Card).
+1 Buy\n+$1\dWhen you discard this from play, you may exchange it for a Soldier.
Once per turn: Turn your Journey token over (it starts face up); then if it's face up, choose up to 3 differently named cards you have in play and gain a copy of each.
Move your Trashing token to an Action Supply pile (when you buy a card from that pile, you may trash a card from your hand.)
+1 Card\n+2 Actions\dWhen you buy this, gain another Port.
You may discard an Attack, two Curses, or six cards. If you do, gain a Gold.
Gain a Silver per Silver you have in play. Each other player puts his -1 Card token on his deck.
+1 Buy\nTurn your Journey token over (it starts face up). If it's face up, +5 Cards.
+1 Card\n+1 Action\nPut this on your Tavern mat.\dAt the start of your turn, you may call this to trash a card from your hand.
+1 Action\nTrash this or a card from your hand. Look at a number of cards from the top of your deck equal to the cost in $ of the trashed card. Put one into your hand and discard the rest.
Worth $2\nWhen you play this, each other player puts his -1 Card token on his deck.
+1 Action\nPut this on your Tavern mat.\dDirectly after resolving an Action, if it's still in play, you may call this, to replay that Action.
+1 Buy\nOnce per turn: Set aside a card from your hand, and put it into your hand at end of turn (after drawing).
+1 Buy\nLook at the top 5 cards of your deck. Discard 3 of them and put the rest back on top of your deck in any order.
Gain an Action card costing up to $4. Move your +1 Buy token to its pile (when you play a card from that pile, you first get +1 Buy).

+$2\n+$1 per other Attack you have in play. Each other player with 4 or more cards in hand discards a card.\dWhen you discard this from play, you may exchange it for a Fugitive.\n(This is not in the Supply)
+1 Action\n+$1\nPlay up to 3 Treasures from your hand. Pay all of your $; +1 Card per $ paid.
Until your next turn, when any other player buys a card, he gains a Curse.\nAt the start of your next turn:\n+$3

Put this on your Tavern mat.\dAt the start of your turn, you may call this, to move your +1 Card, +1 Action, +1 Buy, or +$1 token to an Action Supply pile you have no token on (when you play a card from that pile you first get that bonus).\n(This is not in the Supply.)
Trash up to 2 cards from your hand.\nGain a Silver per card you trashed.
Move your +$1 token to an Action Supply pile (when you play a card from that pile, you first get +$1).
+1 Action\nPut this on your Tavern mat.\nAt the start of your turn, you may call this, to trash a card from your hand, gain a card costing up to $1 more than it, and put that card into your hand.
+2 Buys\nWhen you gain a card this turn, you may put it on top of your deck.

+1 Action
+$1
Gain a Silver per card the player to your right gained in his last turn.\dWhen you discard this from play, you may exchange it for a Warrior.
(This is not in the Supply.)
Worth $2\nWhen you play this, gain a Gold and a Copper.

+2 Cards\nFor each Traveller you have in play (including this) each other player discards the top card of his deck and trashes it if it costs $3 or $4.\dWhen you discard this from play, you may exchange it for a Hero.\n(This is not in the Supply.)
+1 Buy\n+$4\nPut this on your Tavern mat.\dAt the end of your Buy phase, if you have at least $2 unspent, you may discard this from your Tavern mat.
+2 Actions\nReveal your hand. +1 Card per Action card revealed.
Gain a card costing up to 4 Coins. You may trash this. If you do, gain a card costing up to 4 Coins.
Play this as if it were an Action card in the Supply costing up to 5 Coins. This is that card until it leaves play.
+5 Cards\nReveal your hand; discard the Coppers.
This pile starts the game with 5 copies of Encampment on top, then 5 copies of Plunder. Only the top card of the pile can be gained or bought.
This pile starts the game with 5 copies of Patrician on top, then 5 copies of Emporium. Only the top card of the pile can be gained or bought.
This pile starts the game with 5 copies of Settlers on top, then 5 copies of Bustling Village. Only the top card of the pile can be gained or bought.
Sort the castle pile by cost, putting the more expensive Castles on the bottom. For a 2-player game, use only one of each Castle. Only the top card of the pile may be gained or bought.
This pile starts the game with 5 copies of Catapult on top, then 5 copies of Rocks. Only the top card of the pile can be gained or bought.
+1 Action

Until your next turn, the first time each other player plays an Action card on their turn, they get +1 Card and +1 Action instead of following its instructions.\nAt the start of your next turn,\n+1 Cards
+1 Buy\nIf there are 4 Victory or more on the Farmer's Market Supply pile, take them and trash this. Otherwise, add 1 Victory to the pile and then +1 Coin per 1 Victory on the pile.
This pile starts the game with 5 copies of Gladiator on top, then 5 copies of Fortune. Only the top card of the pile can be gained or bought.

Trash a card from your hand. If it's anÂ…
Action card, +1 Cards, +2 Actions
Treasure card, +2 Coins
Victory card, +2 Victory
+1 Victory\nTrash from 1 to 3 differently named cards from your hand. Add 1 Victory to the Temple Supply pile.\dWhen you gain this, take all the Victory from the Temple Supply pile.
+2 Actions\n+1 Buy\n+1 Coin\dWhen you gain this, put it into your hand, +1 Action, and if it's your Buy phase return to your Action phase.
+1 Action\nSet aside the top 3 cards of your deck face down (you may look at them). Now and at the start of your next two turns, put one into your hand.
6 Coins\n+1 Buy\dWhen you discard this from play, take 6 Debt, and then you may pay off Debt.
When you play this, choose one: +1 Buy and +2 Coins; or the next time you buy a card this turn, you may also gain a differently named card with the same cost.
If it's your Action phase, you may play an Action from your hand twice. If it's your Buy phase, you may play a Treasure from your hand twice.
+1 Card\n+1 Action\nDiscard 2 cards.\dWhen you buy this, +1 Buy.
+1 Card\n+1 Action\dWhile this is in play, when you gain a Victory card, +1 Victory.
+3 Coins\nYou may reveal a Gold from your hand. If you do, each other player discards down to 2 cards in hand, then draws a card.
Choose one: +3 Cards and add 1 Victory to the Wild Hunt Supply pile; or gain an Estate, and if you do, take the Victory from the pile.
You may trash an Action card from your hand. If you do, gain an Action card costing up to 6 Coins.
Look through your discard pile. Shuffle all but up to 5 cards from it into your deck. Gain a Duchy.
After this turn, put all cards from your deck and discard pile into your hand, trash any number, shuffle your hand into your deck, then draw 5 cards.
Gain an Estate.\nIf you did, +1 Victory per card you've gained this turn.
+1 Buy\nGain a Silver.
Add 2 Debt to a Supply pile.\dSetup: Add 1 Debt to each Supply pile. When a player buys a card, they take the Debt from its pile.
Gain 2 Coppers and a non-Victory card costing up to 5 Coins.
Gain a Curse. If you do, trash a card from your hand. +1 Victory per 1 Coin it cost.
+1 Victory\nTrash a Victory card from the Supply.
+1 Victory\nGain a Gold.
If your deck and discard pile are empty, gain 3 Golds.
Gain 2 Silvers.\n+1 Victory per Silver you've gained this turn.
Gain a Province. If you do, +9 Victory
When you gain a Treasure, move 1 Victory from its pile to this.\nWhen you gain a Victory card, take the Victory from this.\dSetup: Put 8 Victory on the Silver and Gold piles.
At the start of your Buy phase, you may discard an Action card. If you do, take 2 Victory from here.\dSetup: Put 6 Victory here per player.
When scoring, -2 Victory for each Silver and each Gold you have.
When you buy a card, if you have 2 Coins or more left, take 2 Victory from here.\dSetup: Plus 6 Victory here per player.
When you end your turn without having gained a card, take 2 Victory from here.\dSetup: Put 6 Victory here per player.
When you gain a Victory card, take 2 Victory from here.\dSetup: Put 6 Victory here per player.
When you buy an Action card, if you have a copy of it in play, take 2 Victory from here.\dSetup: Put 6 Victory here per player.
When you gain an Action, move 1 Victory from its pile to this. When you buy a Curse, take the Victory from this.\dSetup: Put 2 Victory on each non-Gathering Action Supply pile.
When scoring, 15 Victory if you have at least 10 Coppers.
When scoring, 5 Victory per differently named Treasure you have, that you have more copies of than each other player, or tied for most.
When you gain a 2nd card in one of your turns, take 2 Victory from here.\dSetup: Put 6 Victory here per player.
When you are the first player to gain a Province, after that turn, each player bids once, up to 40 Debt, ending with you. High bidder gets +8 Victory and takes the Debt they bid.
When scoring, 2 Victory per differently named card you have.
When scoring, 2 Victory per card you have from the chosen pile.\dSetup: Choose a random Action Supply pile.
When scoring, 4 Victory per differently named Action card you have 3 or more copies of.
When scoring, 3 Victory per set you have of Copper - Silver - Gold.
When you trash a card, +1 Victory.
When scoring, 1 Victory per non-Victory card you have from an empty Supply pile.
When scoring, 3 Victory per copy you have of the 2nd most common Action card among your cards (if it's a tie, count either).
When scoring, -1 Victory per card you have after the first 15.
When scoring, -3 Victory per card you have exactly one copy of.
The new card's body text goes here.

get.description: Get a set of Dominion Kingdom Card(s) based on the filter parameters.

example.card_text: Gain a silver card; put it on top of your deck. Each other player reveals a Victory card from his hand and puts it on his deck (or reveals a hand with no Victory cards).
+$2\nEach other player discards down to 3 cards in his hand.
+1 Card\n+1 Action\nEach player (including you) reveals the top card of his deck and either discards it or puts it back, your choice.

Each other player reveals the top 2 cards of his deck. If they revealed any Treasure cards, they trash one of them that you choose. You may gain any or all of these trashed cards. They discard the other revealed cards.

post.description: Add a new Dominion Kingdom Card to the database.

get.description: Request the details of a single Dominion Kingdom Card.
